oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Liberace arrives at Nashville airport, 1950s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Liberace, a famous American pianist and vocalist, was welcomed to Nashville by Mayor Ben West and Harry Draper, Manager of the Ryman Auditorium, circa 1950s. This media publicity event took place at the Berry Field, Nashville Airport. Liberace was a famous American pianist and flamboyant entertainer (born as Wladziu Valentino Liberace). He was the highest-paid entertainer in the world during the 1950s-1970s. Title supplied by cataloger. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 9 photograph negatives : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Liberace, 1919-1987; West, Ben, 1911-1974; Draper, Harry
